intro: Putoria hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish putoria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers and its ability to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. It typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Putoria hispanica is often found in dry, sunny habitats and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
